title: Client Executive Director
description:
Job Description

JOB SUMMARY:

Join our dynamic team as the D365 FSC Sales - Client Executive Director with a specialized focus on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Supply Chain (D365 FSC). As a seasoned professional in this role, you will play a pivotal part in advancing the sales and expansion of D365 FSC consulting services within Argano's esteemed Microsoft Dynamics Practice. The Client Executive Director in Argano's Microsoft Practice is pivotal in supporting the sales and growth of Dynamics365 consulting services. This role demands an in-depth understanding of Microsoft Dynamics365 and the ability to align these services with client needs. The executive is responsible for developing new business opportunities, particularly in the Dynamics365 space, qualifying, and engaging potential clients in the consultative selling cycle, crafting tailored proposals, overseeing the contract process, and closing new business converting prospects into net new customers. The focus is on establishing and adding value through a team based consultative sales process solving client problems with appropriate strategy leveraging Dynamics 365 solutions to drive business transformation and growth for upper midmarket and enterprise clients.

Responsibilities

Initiate and lead sales opportunities for D365 FSC consulting services targeting Small and Medium-Sized Businesses (SMC) and Enterprise clients.Identify and pursue new business opportunities within the Microsoft Dynamics 365 FSC sphere.Cultivate and maintain key client relationships, ensuring satisfaction and alignment with D365 FSC solutions.Develop strategic sales plans specifically for D365 FSC services to meet revenue goals.Impart D365 FSC expertise and sales-focused mentorship to junior team members.Collaborate seamlessly with internal teams to tailor D365 FSC service offerings based on client feedback and evolving needs.Conduct comprehensive market research to uncover untapped opportunities within the D365 FSC ecosystem.Exceed sales targets related to D365 FSC consulting services through strategic planning and execution.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to craft compelling D365 FSC focused proposals and presentations.

Education

Minimum and/or Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Finance, Accounting, or related field, required.MBA or relevant master's degree, with a focus on technology or business management preferred.Preferred: Microsoft Dynamics 365 FSC certifications.

Experience

5 to 8 years of experience in client service or sales, with a distinct focus on Microsoft Dynamics 365 FSC or similar ERP solutions.Proven track record in successfully selling and implementing D365 FSC solutions.Experience in a lead role within a team-selling environment.Strong negotiation and communication skills, particularly in consulting and technology contexts.

Skill Requirements

Sales Acumen: Demonstrate an exceptional ability to not only meet but exceed targets in the D365 FSC domain.Dynamics 365 FSC Knowledge: Showcase a profound understanding of Microsoft Dynamics 365 FSC capabilities and their application in various business contexts.Strategic Thinking: Ability to develop and execute strategic plans revolving around D365 FSC services.Communication Skills: Exhibit exceptional skills in articulating the value of D365 FSC solutions to a diverse client base.

About Us

Argano is the first of its kind: a digital consultancy totally immersed in high-performance operations. We steward enterprises through ever-evolving markets, empowering them with transformative strategies and technologies to exceed customer expectations, unlock commercial innovation, and drive optimal efficiency and growth.

Argano is an equal-opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Machine Operator - 2nd Shift
description:
Founded in 2009 and headquartered in Downers Grove, IL we are a world-class contract manufacturer producing wholesome baked goods, snacks and packaged foods for many of the world’s leading food companies. As one of the largest and fastest growing food co-manufacturing companies in the US, we are the proud owner and operator of over 35 facilities globally. Our nearly 10,000 employee-strong organization is leading the way and setting new standards for quality, safety, flexibility and efficiency while feeding families around the globe.

Hearthside’s exceptional growth stems from its ability to address real-world problems for customers of all shapes and sizes, and by our resolute commitment to our belief that there are no great companies without great culture. Our culture of personal empowerment enables growth, learning, and continuous improvement every day!

We are steadfast in our ambition to be the indispensable and most trusted partner to our customers and need your help to do it! Join Hearthside and enjoy a competitive package, outstanding benefits and a diverse work environment.

 What We Want to Give You: 

We offer a competitive wage and wide array of benefits including:

 health/dental/vision insurance 401(k) retirement plan flex spending accounts short & long-term disability paid holidays and vacation bonus opportunities (referral, production, etc.).

 Job Summary: 

The Machine Operator performs set-ups, makes minor adjustments and operates packaging equipment. Identifies acceptable or unacceptable product quality per customer requirements. Performs wash and changeover of equipment. Machine Operators will need to be reliable and able to work with Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP’s) at all times.

 Job Duties and Responsibilities: 

 Performs accurate set ups on equipment in preparation for particular product runs.  Operates equipment and adjusts as necessary to ensure equipment is operating correctly and meeting quality specifications.  Inspects and tests packages, and documents results to ensure equipment is operating correctly and meeting quality specifications.  Stages and checks required materials for quick and accurate change overs in production.  Completes and assembles all required documentation associated with the position.  Maintains works area in a clean and organized manner.  Must be willing to occasionally work “on the line” to support production as needed.  Performs all other duties as assigned. 

 Required Qualifications: 

 Must be 18 years of age and authorized to work in the U.S.  1+ years of experience as a Machine Operator in a manufacturing production facility ( REQUIRED ).  Must be able to demonstrate proficiency in operating specific food manufacturing and packaging machines (IE: film thermoforming machines, cup/tray film sealers, multipond scales, etc.).  Knowledgeable (or willing to learn) GMPs and the HACCP program.  Must have the ability to understand and follow all safety policies and procedures.  Must have the ability to handle small tools.  Good organizational and communication skills in order to prioritize work and communicate changes to line workers.  Team environment – must be able to work well with others and communicate in a respectful and professional manner.  Must be able to work necessary overtime based on staffing needs and customer demand, as well as across shifts.  Sufficient math skills to calculate quantities of material required for orders being run. 

 Preferred Qualifications: 

 Experience in a food-related manufacturing facility (preferred).  Experience performing machine changeovers (preferred).  Experience performing quality checks (preferred).  SAP computer system experience (preferred).  High school diploma or equivalent (preferred).  Ability to read and write in English (preferred). 

 Work Environment and Physical Requirements: 

 Manufacturing environment - exposure to a variety of machines, noise levels, and varying temperatures.  Team environment - must be able to work well with others and communicate in a respectful and professional manner.  Must be willing to work regularly in cold temperatures often ranging from 32 to 40 degrees.  Ability to stand up to 80% of the time scheduled.  Ability to lift 40 lbs. unassisted and 40-75 lbs. assisted.  Must be able to work necessary overtime based on staffing needs and customer demand, as well as across shifts. 

Hearthside is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Apply Now

title: Scientist II, Quality Control
description:
Job Description

Description:

The Scientist II - QC is responsible for performing testing of raw materials, in-process and finished pharmaceutical dosage forms, products on stability, cleaning verification samples following written procedures and applicable SOPs, calculating and reporting results on applicable specification documents, participating in method transfer activities within departments or between facilities or organizations. Provides feedback on systems and analytical procedures to promote continuous improvement and enhancement of compliance posture.

Essential Functions:


Performs chemical analysis of raw materials, in-process and finished pharmaceutical products, including products on stability, according to written methods or compendial methods as applicable, material specifications, using analytical techniques such as IR spectroscopy, UV-Vis spectroscopy, and chromatographic techniques, adhering to company policies as identified in standard operating procedures (SOPs).Prepares samples for analysis involving thorough cleanliness and complex steps for analysis using chromatographic techniques and analyzes. Creates and maintains laboratory record documentation (notebooks and computer-based), documents exact steps followed during analysis execution, calculates and reports results in a timely manner.Actively participates in method transfer activities between facilities within the organization or between organizations.Actively participates in and leads investigation of out-of-specification laboratory results, when required.Performs physical analysis involving complex techniques such as X-ray diffraction, DSC, Malvern mastersizer.Prepares and executes method transfer protocols, method verification/validation protocols as and when required.


Additional Responsibilities:


Assists, as and when needed, senior scientists working in the laboratory.Ensures that expired chemicals and reference standards are removed from laboratory area, performs calibration of dissolution apparatus, FT-IR, UV-Vis spectrophotometer, HPLC, GC as assigned by the supervisor.Standardizes API for use as in-house reference standard as assigned.Interacts with newly hired laboratory technicians or Assistant Scientists for providing hands-on training on simple analytical techniques and laboratory instruments.


Qualifications

Education:


Bachelors Degree (BA/BS) Chemistry or related science discipline - RequiredMaster Degree (MBA) Chemistry or related science discipline - Preferred


Experience:


3 years or more in Bachelors Degree (BA/BS) -Testing of chemicals/pharmaceutical products, 3 years or more1 year or more in Master Degree (MA/MS) -Testing of chemicals/pharmaceutical products, 1 years or more


Skills:


Must be precise and consistent in day-to-day analysis, using sophisticated analytical instruments. - AdvancedMust be familiar with out of specification and out of alert limit investigations. - IntermediateMust be able to execute compendial procedures involving complexity. - IntermediateMust be familiar with cGMP and OSHA regulations. - IntermediateMust be able to effectively communicate results, problems or issues, verbally as well as in writing. - IntermediateMust be computer literate and savvy with MS office applications, software programs related to LIMS. - IntermediateMust be able to work in a team environment and be flexible to easily adapt to changes in assignments. - IntermediateMust follow safe practices as identified in appropriate MSDS during working with chemicals, and must follow applicable state and federal regulations. - IntermediateMust be capable of maintaining clear and concise laboratory records and communicating clearly both within and between departments. - IntermediateMust be thoroughly familiar with cGMP applicable to laboratories in pharmaceutical settings and with method verification/validation concepts. Must be able to review laboratory records to ascertain compliance with applicable specifications, methods, and SOPs. - IntermediateMust be able to assume a role of a leader in team environment as and when required. - Beginner


The annual base salary for this position ranges from $75,000 to $95,000. Amneal ranges reflect the Company’s good faith estimate of base salary that Amneal reasonably believes that it will pay for said position at the time of the posting. Individual compensation will ultimately be determined based on a variety of relevant factors, including but not limited to, qualifications, geographic location and other relevant skills. At the heart of our Total Rewards commitment is a comprehensive, flexible and competitive benefits program for eligible positions that enables you to choose the plans and coverage that meet your personal needs. This includes above-market, diverse and robust health and insurance benefits to meet the varied needs of our employees as well as a significant 401(k) matching contribution to help our employees save for retirement. We also promote employee well-being with programs that helps you enjoy your career alongside life’s many other commitments and opportunities.

About Us

Amneal is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of sex, age, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability, veteran status, liability for service in the U.S. Armed Forces or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

title: Implementation Specialist I
description:
ADP is hiring an Implementation Specialist. 

 Are you ready to join a company offering career advancement opportunities throughout your career journey?  Are you looking for an inclusive environment with a culture of collaboration and belonging? 

If so, this may be an opportunity for you. Read on and decide for yourself.

As an Implementation Specialist, imagine yourself as part of the "new client welcome committee"... but with a special twist. When you join our implementation team, you onboard new clients and get them comfortable using our products and services. You make sure our products and services don't just deliver but exceed client expectations. And you're not doing it alone. We're with you every step of the way through our award-winning training programs and world-class service guidelines. Here, you'll feel you're making an impact and gain the knowledge and expertise to grow your career in the process.

A little about ADP: We are a global leader in human resources technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, human resources, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition as a global Best Places to Work and a recipient of many prestigious awards for diversity, equity, and inclusion, including a DiversityInc® Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. As part of our deep DEI commitment, our CEO has joined the OneTen coalition to create one million jobs for Black Americans over the next ten years. Learn more about DEI at ADP on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI_Videos

Ready to #MakeYourMark?  Apply now!

To learn more about Implementation at ADP, watch here: https://adp.careers/Client_Services_Videos

WHAT YOU'LL DO: Responsibilities

What You Can Expect On a Typical Day

Consult with Clients to Deliver a Comprehensive ADP Solution. You will partner with clients to understand their business and related needs. You will guide and drive clients towards the best solution for their needs.

Implement ADP Technologies. You will analyze existing systems, interface requirements, and business processes. You will incorporate new processes, tools, and approaches when recommending and implementing the ADP solution.

Partner Internally. You will interact/collaborate with ADP associates in sales and customer service. You will exchange routine information with members of the client project team, including priorities, timeliness, and issues as they arise.

Multi-Task & Communicate. Your ability to work on multiple time-sensitive follow-ups / projects at the same time is essential to succeeding in this role. You can clearly and concisely share essential information and you are comfortable and skilled in using Microsoft Office products.

TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE: Required Qualifications

 You have at least three years of experience working in a client service/customer service environment, with at least one year of business consulting experience. 

Required

A college degree is great but not required. What's more important is having the skills to do the job. If you don't have a college degree, other acceptable experiences could include:

 Experience noted above OR  Military Experience. We recognize and appreciate the unique talents and experiences veterans bring to the table. We value the discipline, commitment, and problem-solving abilities you developed and are excited to provide an environment where you can continue to make a meaningful impact.

You'll Love Working Here Because You Can

 Be yourself in a culture that values equity, inclusion, and belonging and creates a safe space for diverse perspectives and insights.  Belong by joining one of ten Business Resource Groups to connect globally with networks and allies who share common interests and experiences.  Grow your career in an agile, fast-paced environment with plenty of opportunities to progress.  Continuously learn. Ongoing training, development, and mentorship opportunities for even the most insatiable learner.  Be your healthiest. Best-in-class benefits start on Day 1 because healthy associates are happy ones.  Focus on your mental health and well-being. We're here to provide exceptional service to our clients, and none of that happens without each of us taking care of ourselves and being there for one another.  Join a company committed to giving back and generating a lasting, positive impact upon the communities in which we work and live.   Get paid to pay it forward. Company-paid time off for volunteering for causes you care about. 

What are you waiting for? Apply now!

jobs.adp.com

Base salary offers for this position may vary based on factors such as location, skills, and relevant experience. Some positions may include additional compensation in the form of bonus, equity or commissions. We offer the following benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Matched Retirement Savings, Wellness Program, Short-and Long-Term Disability, Charitable Contribution Match, Holidays, Personal Days & Vacation, Paid Volunteer Time Off, and more. The compensation for this role is $15.00 - $27.40 / Hour

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP’s operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.

Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.

title: Mechanical Engineer - InterContinental San Antonio Riverwalk (Hotel Opening)
description:
A little taste of your day-to-day:

Respond and attend to guests/ customers to resolve maintenance issues.Perform preventive maintenance equipment along with mechanical room equipment, including cleaning and lubrication.Program and monitor energy management equipment to operate at maximum operational efficiency and avoid peak demand charges and penalties.Perform monitoring the operation of pools and maintain the water parameters.Lead and train the heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) team in the operation of energy management equipment and calibration of equipment.Monitor and troubleshoot pressure vessels, boiler permits and boiler controls.Log boiler water parameters regularly and maintain as per the limits.Act as a member of the Emergency Response Team, responding in cases of fire, accident, safety concerns and calls for medical assistance.Visually inspect equipment or machines and record any abnormality.Identify, locate, and operate all shut-off valves for equipment and all utility shut-offs for buildings.Maintain maintenance inventory and requisition parts and supplies as needed.Initiate action to correct a hazardous situation and notify supervisors of potential dangers.Log security incidents and accidents in accordance with hotel requirements.

What we need from you:

Adhere to Engineering Policies and ProceduresReport problems to Management with suggestions for resolution.Clarifies own job responsibilities and looks for opportunities that will increase skills and job knowledge.Anticipate guest needs, handle guest enquires, and solve problems.Communicate well to ensure effective shift hand-overs.Develop/update skills and knowledge (internally or externally) to reflect changed technology or changed work requirements.Ensure that your work quality meets the standards required and complete tasks in a timely and thorough manner with minimum supervision.Follow standards, policies and procedures.

What you can expect from us:

We’ll reward all your hard work with competitive salary and benefits.

Join us and you’ll become part of the global IHG® family – and like all families, all our individual team members share some winning characteristics. As a team, we work better together – we trust and support each other, we do the right thing and we welcome different perspectives. You need to show us you care: that you notice the little things that make a difference to guests as well as always looking for ways to improve - visit www.careers.ihg.com to find out more about us.

So go on - show us how your passion and personality are the perfect fit to deliver memorable experiences to our guests.

At IHG, we’ve made a promise. As one of the world’s leading hotel groups, we’re here to deliver True Hospitality for Good. Making our guests and colleagues feel welcome, cared for, recognized and respected – wherever they are in the world. Want to be part of the journey?

As the world’s first and most global luxury hotel brand, InterContinental Hotels & Resorts has pioneered international travel since the 1940s, we are passionate about sharing our renowned international know-how and cultural wisdom in truly impressive surroundings. We all take great pride in being genuine ambassadors of the InterContinental®️ brand and to be part of the brand you will have a thirst for travel, passion for culture and appreciation for diversity. We create inspiring experiences for those seeking a richer perspective on the world. If you’d like to embrace a world of opportunities, we’d like to welcome you to the world’s most international luxury hotel brand. Let’s Go Further Together.

Don't quite meet every single requirement, but still believe you'd be a great fit for the job? We'll never know unless you hit the 'Apply' button. Start your journey with us today.

title: Regional Director Design - Architecture
description:
About Us

Bringing True Hospitality to the world.

We want to welcome you to a world of bringing True Hospitality to everyone. When you join us at IHG®, you become part of our global family. A welcoming culture of warmth, honesty, and a passion for providing True Hospitality.

We pride ourselves on letting your personality and passions shine, recognizing the individual contribution you make and supporting your ambition to learn and create your own career path. In making a difference to our guests and owners, colleagues and communities, every day is a chance to create great and unique experiences, in your own way.

With over 370,000 colleagues in nearly 100 countries sharing our values, there’s countless opportunities at your fingertips.

We’re growing; grow with us.

Key Responsibilities

Job Summary – (Role Summary)

In collaboration with regional and global colleagues, the Regional Director of Design will lead the strategic visioning, development, and maintenance of IHG’s efforts to accelerate guest and owner-insight-driven design innovation within the Americas. Lead and mentor a team of architects and interior designers responsible for creating and embedding IHG’s brand design programs that will be implemented by our franchisees in their new construction and renovation projects. Plan, scope, and engage external consultants to design and estimate new architectural initiatives that deliver industry-leading design with the highest-potential value for guests and owners. Train and support the regional Design Review, New Construction and Property Improvement (PIP) project teams as they work with franchisees to implement the prototype design programs.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities – (Key Activities)

Manage brand design initiatives for the Americas region from scoping and program development through concepting and commercialization by working with internal stakeholders and external consultants to deliver brand-defining design principles, programs, model rooms, prototype designs, brand standards and design guidelines for all brands, in accordance with funding allocations, deadlines, and/or direction established by senior leadership.Develop and regularly update hypothetical project development estimates in a standardized format for all IHG brands leveraging external cost estimating consultants, internal data, and industry knowledge.Work as design lead responsible for collaborating with a multi-disciplinary team to deliver original, creative solutions in a collaborative and timely manner.Represent the design team to internal and external stakeholders, communicating the status of brand design initiatives, project trends, design issues, and owner feedback.Apply design talent to problem-solving design exercises to achieve cost-efficient results that align with brand standards and brand strategy by facilitating best practice and customer trend evolutions.Liaise with the Global and Regional Brand Standards team to supply all relevant data to enable design standards to be written and implemented within the region.Coach and develop team members; hire, assess, discipline, document performance and recommend salary and classification changes. Act as an advisor to staff to help meet established schedules and/or resolve technical or operational problems. Train new consultants as needed. Research and communicate any design and construction trend changes and/or suggest improvements in order to keep IHG’s brand design and construction requirements innovative and competitive.Be active and informed in building a strong and relevant complement of external consulting partners for future development and execution of brand design initiatives.Communicate and monitor project specifications with outside vendors (architectural, interior design, engineering and/or contracting firms) to ensure scope and responsibilities are understood, and to ensure projects progress according to plan and IHG requirements.Work with Global Procurement to evaluate and recommend program suppliers.Contribute to ongoing development of Americas Design & Construction department’s internal and external processes, tools and resources.Actively participate in regular Design leadership meetings, providing input on team staffing, engagement and growth, as well as product and prototype design strategies and issues.Develop, train and maintain templates and ways of working.Organize and supervise construction and renovation of model rooms at IHG’s Design Center or in-hotel pilots. Examples of assigned activities include: planning, budgeting and scheduling of all work; scope development and engagement of 3rd-party project team; negotiating pricing, overseeing and directing the purchase, delivery and installation of materials and furnishings; ensuring timely project completion and project closeout.Prepare installation, construction, and consultant contracts in cooperation with the Global Procurement and Legal Departments.Prepare, communicate, and maintain project schedules and project budgets. Track cost and payment information as needed; identify trends or issues and resolve them in a timely manner, bringing critical issues to immediate attention (examples include cost overruns, schedule adjustments, issues with vendors or vendor approval status, issues with insurance, compliance issues, etc.). Compile project cost reports for review.Assist Brand Management Teams in the design and execution of brand design experiences for IHG Investor’s Conference and industry events.Manage or contribute as needed to special projects related to the planning, budgeting, design and construction of hotels.

Required Qualifications

Education –

Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Architecture, or a relevant field of work, or an equivalent combination of education and hotel design and construction work-related experience.

Experience –

10+ years extensive progressive work experience in Design, Architecture, and/or Construction Management with demonstrated proficiency in hotel new development and renovation lifecycles. A minimum of 2 years prior Project Management experience related to hotel design and construction is preferred.

Technical Skills and Knowledge –

Ability to work in a high volume, fast-paced, on-time, delivery focused environment as a member of a collaborative team. Responsiveness to demands from multiple stakeholder groups and ability to understand and balance consumer, managerial and ownership perspectives.Ability to manage multiple priorities and resources. Ability to effectively prioritize project details and manage time. Must make immediate time available to work with franchisees when problems arise regarding brand design projects, brand standards or vendor-related issues. Strong problem solving and time management skills required. High degree of personal drive, self-starter and ability to work independently without regular direct/local management. Attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks required. An inventive mindset focused on re-imagining and crafting design environments to meet the challenges of differentiated brands and maintaining industry competitiveness.Ability to quickly and accurately assess the scope of implementation of proposed innovation/design proposals and up-to-date on current trends and innovation in the sector.Strong communicator and relationship builder, with the ability to be diplomatic while providing a strong design leadership voice in successful engagements across a large organization.Commercially astute and able to develop credible ROI`s for design initiatives with a good ‘real world’ sensibility when proposing design strategies.Knowledge and application of brand standards in a franchise environment.Strong ability to create and understand technical design drawings including architectural, interiors, millwork, mechanical, plumbing, electrical, and life safety drawings. Demonstrated knowledge of FF&E (furnishings, finishes and equipment) and OS&E (operating supplies and equipment). Ability to work as an individual contributor that creates and communicates design experiences, style and aesthetic using digital and physical design boards, free-hand sketches, layouts or other drawings, design guides and specifications to provide clarity of design direction.Must have knowledge of national building codes and accessibility requirements. Ability to remain current with construction trends, code requirements and design through participating in annual continuing education classes. Demonstrated ability to effectively manage $1 million + design projects with minimal direction, including demonstrated ability to manage large design project budgets and small-scale construction projects.Must have project management experience in organizing, planning and executing complex, large and scale projects from conception through implementation.Demonstrated proficiency marking up technical drawings in Bluebeam Revu and creating/editing documents in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint along with high proficiency and everyday use of Adobe Creative Suite applications. CAD, Revit, 3D modeling, illustration and graphic design proficiency is preferred.

ACCOUNTABILITY

Number of employees supervised: Direct 1 Indirect 8

This position independently hires and supervises teams of contractors and professional consultants for each project.

Annual operating and/or payroll budget(s):

Staffing budget managed by Design & Construction LeadershipThis position manages project budgets of $100K-1M annually on various brand design projects Indirect influence of franchisee project budgets on new builds ($10-100M). Indirect influence of brand guest experience development budgets of up to $500K annually (e.g. model guest rooms)

Decision making responsibilities (Key Decision Rights):

Delivery of commercialized innovations and designs (delivery of agreed targets).Review of prototype plans and specifications for technical detail of architecture and construction for safety regulations, brand standards, design principles and technical specifications. Management of all aspects of the Brand’s design programs (design strategy guides, prototype drawings, and FF&E SRD Schemes for guestrooms and public spaces), including planning and carrying out all related projects and activities from start to finish working with internal and external key relationships.Use of strong judgment and decision-making skills in determining practical applications for hotels when reviewing design boards, product submittals, cost analysis and brand initiatives. This position makes a careful study of various internal reports and determines current conditions, trends and competition, thereby ensuring that our hotel brands maintain a competitive edge in their marketplace.Decisions to revise brand standards may be made after thorough research and evaluation of specification requirements.Independently complete the successful implementation of a variety of daily projects, or work as a part of the Design & Construction team to independently handle smaller portions of large projects (e.g. communication, contracts, vendor relations, etc.).

CONTACTS (Key Relationships)

Internal Key Relationships –

Global Brand Management, Global Guest Experience / Innovation and Marketing Teams, Global and Regional Brand Standards, Consumer Insights, Design & Construction/Technical Services, Regional Franchise Development, Operations, Legal, Risk Management, and Food & Beverage

External Key Relationships –

Franchise Owners, Senior Corporate Franchise Management, Management Companies, Contractors and Architectural and Interior Design Firms.

Physical Requirements

Ability to travel 15% of time required.

Majority of work is performed in a normal office environment.

The statements in this job description are intended to represent the key duties, essential nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be all responsibilities or qualifications of the job.

What we offer

We’ll reward all your hard work with a great salary and benefits – including great room discount and superb training.

Join us and you’ll become part of the global IHG family – and like all families, all our individual team members share some winning characteristics. As a team, we work better together – we trust and support each other, we do the right thing and we welcome different perspectives. You need to show us you care, that you notice the little things that make a difference to guests as well as always looking for ways to improve - click here to find out more about us.

At IHG Hotels & Resorts, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. IHG Hotels & Resorts provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to an individual's, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, marital or familial status, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. IHG is committed to promoting a culture of inclusion where everyone feels safe, respected and valued. We seek talent from all backgrounds to join our teams, and encourage our colleagues to bring their authentic and best selves to work.

At IHG, we’ve made a promise. As one of the world’s leading hotel groups, we’re here to deliver True Hospitality for Good. Making our guests and colleagues feel welcome, cared for, recognised and respected – wherever they are in the world. Want to be part of the journey?

We need people like you to make a difference and create exceptional experiences every single day. Don’t just join a growing team of 370,000 colleagues across 100 countries. Let your passion shine. Innovate and collaborate around the world. Embrace your ambition.

Don't quite meet every single requirement, but still believe you'd be a great fit for the job? We'll never know unless you hit the 'Apply' button. Start your journey with us today.

title: Technical Program Manager
description:
Telesat Government Solutions (TGS) is a wholly owned subsidiary based in Arlington, VA with responsibility to take all of Telesat’s products to US and foreign Government customers, to devise solutions to fit user community requirements, to ensure that Telesat’s products are fit-for-purpose, and to prepare a scalable organization to meet the needs of delivering on Lightspeed’s promised service levels.

To support our USG customers, TGS manages a number of programs that will lead to adoption of Telesat’s Lightspeed connectivity services and develop technology understanding that will provide insights about satellite technology and capabilities that will enhance our capability to serve USG users.

TGS is seeking a seasoned Technical Program Manager (PM) to lead our efforts to take these studies and projects to conclusion and to drive the capture of new programs.

Role Responsibilities

Responsibility for day-to-day execution of one or multiple programs and studies based on size and complexity. This includes managing internal resources within TGS and the parent company, as well as coordinating teaming partners and vendors to ensure contract and program deliverables are achieved within the scope of the program. Understanding of key user communities needs and cultures is critical to success, particularly in translating requirements into realistic solutions and deliverables in furtherance of program objectives. Identifying, winning, and supporting new programs that develop greater Lightspeed awareness within the USG, and that -lead to the adoption of its new technology, capabilities or service platforms that will meet USG mission requirements. PM will be a senior member of the TGS leadership team to help create a culture of collaboration and inclusiveness and keep the focus on the strategic priorities of the customer and TGS. The candidate must have a win-win mentality – the ability to find the most beneficial solution to challenges for all stakeholders. The candidate will be responsible for all technical, business, project functions and for managing all program costs, schedule and deliverables. Day to day duties will include briefing all levels of the TGS and parent organization as well as external briefs to customers and various government agencies. 

Required Applicant Education, Experience, & Skills

U.S. Citizenship status is necessary as this position will require an active U.S. TOP SECRET/SCISecurity ClearanceThis position will be based out of the TGS office in Arlington, VA10+ years of professional work experience in managing complex systems programs, demonstrations and studies or other relevant experience. Strong written and verbal communication skills, with experience working with and making presentations to government customers and senior leadership. Must have deep knowledge of program management. Advanced knowledge of related disciplines within work area and ability to identify linkages and potential impact on projects, programs, or systems. Experience in leading competitive and sole source proposals and to lead capture strategy and proposal efforts and Risk management experience. Experience serving DoD customers as a collaborative partner, with extensive knowledge of DoD research laboratories, Program Offices, Program Executive Offices and HQ’s staffs across different. Services and agencies. Prior military service in related space and telecom fields is highly desirable. Requires broad management and leadership knowledge to lead project teams. Must be a self-starter with the ability to multi-task, address multiple issues and set priorities. Must be reliable organized, flexible and detail oriented. Ability to monitor, interact and course correct technical and project teams to support evolving customer requirements. Excellent business sense to proactively identify and resolve problems and issues quickly and efficiently. Demonstrated ability to initiate and sustain positive customer relationships. Deep and recent successful experience with NASA and DoD Research LaboratoriesDemonstrated experience leading development programs including spiral upgrades to existing hardware and software systems and Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) experience. Experience in Competitive Captures and New Business DevelopmentSatellite manufacturing, satellite operations or satellite terminal technology knowledgeCurrent Top Secret / SCI Clearance is highly desired. 

Preferred Education

A bachelor’s degree in engineering or a related technical discipline and a minimum of 12 years’ prior relevant experience; an advanced degree in a technical or related field and minimum10 years’ experience Engineering/Other Technical Positions is highly desirable. 

At Telesat Government Services, we take pride in being an equal opportunity employer that values diversity in the workplace. Qualified applicants will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, color, religion, genetic information, marital status, ancestry, national origin, protected veteran status, physical disability, medical condition, mental disability, or disability status and any other characteristic protected by state or federal law. We are committed to providing the best candidate experience possible including any required accommodations at every stage of our interview process.

All qualified applicants that have been selected for an interview that require accommodations, are advised to inform the Telesat Talent team accordingly. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential.

title: Associate Finance Business Analyst
description:
Requisition ID: 5866

Job Title: Associate Finance Business Analyst

Job Country: United States (US)

Here at Avanos Medical, we passionately believe in three things:

 Making a difference in our products, services and offers, never ceasing to fight for groundbreaking solutions in everything we do;  Making a difference in how we work and collaborate, constantly nurturing our nimble culture of innovation;  Having an impact on the healthcare challenges we all face, and the lives of people and communities around the world. 

At Avanos you will find an environment that strives to be independent and different, one that supports and inspires you to excel and to help change what medical devices can deliver, now and in the future.

The Avanos COVID-19 Vaccine Policy: This Policy applies to U.S. customer-facing / field-based employees & Avanos leadership: All U.S. customer-facing / field-based employees hires must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Proof of being fully vaccinated does not need to be disclosed until a job offer has been made but must be submitted within 48 hours after the acceptance of the job offer. If you have a qualifying medical condition or sincerely held religious belief or practice that precludes you from receiving a COVID-19 vaccine, you may apply for an exemption or deferral after you accept the job offer and before your scheduled start date. The reasonable accommodation provided to the employee, if any, will depend on the employee’s job and the applicable facts, but it may include weekly COVID-19 testing and masking requirements. New hires who do not submit, before their scheduled start date, proof of being fully vaccinated or a request for a reasonable accommodation will have their job offer revoked.

Avanos is a medical device company focused on delivering clinically superior breakthrough solutions that will help patients get back to the things that matter. We are committed to creating the next generation of innovative healthcare solutions which will address our most important healthcare needs, such as reducing the use of opioids while helping patients move from surgery to recovery. Headquartered in Alpharetta, Georgia, we develop, manufacture and market recognized brands in more than 90 countries. Avanos Medical is traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol AVNS. For more information, visit www.avanos.com .

We are currently seeking an Associate Business Analyst to support our Global FP&A organization, reporting to the Director of Finance. This is a unique hybrid role that will support both the commercial and corporate FP&A teams.

The Commercial FP&A aspect of the role will consist of serving as a financial partner to functions within the commercial organization including commercial operations, reimbursement, and strategic initiatives teams. The individual will be responsible for building budgets, reports, and analysis to help drive accountability of spend and activities through insightful analysis, forward thinking recommendations, and counseling in the development and implementation of the commercial teams’ strategies and objectives.

The Corporate FP&A aspect of the role will involve assisting the finance organization with the management reporting system (BPC), providing support and guidance during reporting, budgeting, and forecasting processes. The individual will be the main point of contact between the finance users and our IT partners to document any system issues and lead remediation efforts. The individual will also be the point of contact for ad-hoc requests from other corporate functions including tax, treasury, and accounting.

The Associate Business Analyst will be a key member of the cross-functional team responsible for business and operations analysis, financial planning and reporting, and other financial, strategic, and tactical services.

Principal Duties And Responsibilities

 Lead the quarterly forecast and annual budget process for the Commercial support functions  Effectively communicate financial performance across the organization  Support month-end close activities to ensure timely and accurate results  Enhance operating expense visibility and bring accountability to spending activities with budget owners  Work with the Director to evaluate internal and external strategic opportunities  Assist with our management reporting system (train new users, setup forecast and budget scenarios, document and work with our IT partners for remediation and improvement)  Assist and lead special ad hoc projects as needed 

Minimum Qualifications

 Minimum 3 years of experience in a finance or analysis role  Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business or other related field  Ability to deal with multiple tasks, work under strict deadlines, and prioritize effectively to complete requests in a timely manner  Strong oral, written, and presentation skills to deliver effective, confident, and results-oriented communications and presentations, including to senior executives  Broad understanding of finance, economics, business management, business/strategic planning  Advanced Excel skills and ability to build financial models, reports, tools  Self-starter/ ability to work independently 

Preferred

 MBA  SAP, BPC, and Power BI experience  Prior knowledge, exposure, or general interest in medical device industry

title: Scrum Master
description:
Job Category: Information Technology

Time Type: Full time

Minimum Clearance Required to Start: None

Employee Type: Regular

* * *

What You’ll Get To Do

CACI is seeing a technical Scrum Master who will be working dynamically in a fast-paced environment supporting and building new capabilities for the Procurement Integrated Enterprise Environment (PIEE), which consists of many modules spanning all aspects of the Department of Defense (DoD) procurement lifecycle from solicitation through contract closeout.

More About The Role

The Scrum Master is responsible for leading the software development agile team by overseeing design, implementation, Quality Assurance, and validation of programming code and products; creating project outlines and timelines; facilitating daily scrums, stand-ups, and meetings to monitor project progress and resolve any issues the team may be experiencing; removing project obstacles; documenting progress and communicating to appropriate audience.

What You’ll Get To Do:

Lead Agile product teams in a SAFe Agile organizationConduct Agile SAFe ceremonies and eventsTrack and collect Agile metrics for inclusion into program level metricsFacilitate team velocity and remove blockersSupports Shared Services and technical program leadership in conducting release planning, system design and system implementation as neededResponsible for team performance to include delivery of documented deliverablesCreates meeting agendas and tracks after action items to closure for meetings as requiredFacilitates team communications and updates Program Management Office (PMO), product owner, product stakeholders, and staff as appropriatePrepares briefings on product status for both CACI and Government leadershipCollaborates effectively with team members across multiple organizationsEffectively documents and manages customer expectations in a fast-paced and fluid environmentAssists Quality/Program Manager with the creation of contract deliverable documentation

You’ll Bring These Qualifications

Must have a SAFe Scrum Master CertificationExperience managing projects in similar size and with multiple competing prioritiesExperience managing IT projects using either Agile Scrum or Kanban methodologiesExperience supporting Government contractsAdaptable and able to work constructively with a technically and geographically diverse teamExcellent written and verbal communication skillsWork collaboratively within a cross-functional team environment; working with others to meet aggressive time-based goals and high-quality standardsMust be US Citizen and be able to obtain a Secret security clearance

These Qualifications Would Be Nice To Have

Experience with SAFeManagerial experienceBusiness Analysis experienceFamiliar with one or more of the following: DoD Contracting, DoD Purchase/Acquisition, DoD Supply/Logistics and/or DoD Payment processing.Familiar with JIRA, Confluence or similar programsFamiliar with Mockflow or similar wireframe programs and conceptsJAVA Software Development experience

Typically has a University Degree (BA/BS) or equivalent experience and minimum 5 years of related work experience.

title: Supervisor, Quality Control Lab
description:
Job Description

Description:

The Quality Control Lab Supervisor prepares testing schedules based on priorities, provides hands-on training to new hires, supervises daily testing activities to assure adherence to procedures, cGMP, and SOPs applicable to laboratories, conducts laboratory investigations when needed, participates in cross-functional teams to understand priorities, commit and deliver as committed.

Essential Functions:


Schedules testing/review of raw materials, in-process, finished product, and stability samples, complaint samples, samples from process and cleaning validation activities; assignments shall be in writing and a day in advance.Drives effective and efficient shop floor supervision enforcing compliance to data integrity, SOPs, specifications, methods, USP, and cGMP through real time verification of records, LNB, log book, chromatograms, sequences, etc. Helps analysts by trouble shooting methods, instrumentation and execution of the tests.Initiates OOS/OOAL investigation, participates in investigation activities, and closes in the books when approved, in a timely manner. Prepares reports of investigation, method transfers, method verification/validation where required. Ensures implementation of CAPA, as identified during the investigations.Ensures timely testing and release of raw materials, in-process, finished products, stability samples from the lab. Reviews and approves, COA, stability summary reports, investigations, APR trend data, calibrations, qualifications, and other analytical records as needed.Initiates change controls for revisions to any controlled document (SOPs, methods, stability protocol,and specification) applicable to quality laboratory.Reviews changes in compendial methods for applicable products and notifies management of such changes in order to determine appropriate course of action.Has all laboratory personnel complete weekly worksheet, reviews worksheets with respect to schedules, and submits completed worksheets. Involved in day-to-day laboratory testing and help analysts as and when needed.Reviews method transfer protocols/reports/vendor qualifications reports/USP monograph evaluation reports/training records. Identifies training needs and provides necessary training to the analysts as and when needed.


Additional Responsibilities:


Participates in analysis as and when required for special projects. When required, summarizes data for in-process testing, testing and release of finished products, and stability data for trending.Attends production planning meeting and updates list with delivery dates committed, tracks delivery dates with respect to committed dates. Submits a list containing weekly samples-in and out.


Qualifications

Education:


Bachelors Degree (BA/BS) Chemistry or related technical field - RequiredMaster Degree (MS/MA) Chemistry or related technical field - Preferred


Experience:


5 years or more in Pharmaceutical Laboratory (With Bachelors)1 year or more in Supervisory Experience (With Bachelors)3 years or more in Pharmaceutical Laboratory (With Masters)2 years or more in Supervisory Experience ( With Masters)


Skills:


Must be precise and consistent in laboratory data interpretations with respect to USP general chapters and applicable FDA guidances, easily trainable, ready to learn, thorough in reviewing and evaluating laboratory data with respect to established specifications. - AdvancedMust have a thorough understanding of analytical chemistry and analytical techniques used in a laboratory setting. - AdvancedMust be able to identify and troubleshoot problems arising during the course of execution of approved methods. - IntermediateMust be flexible to adapt to changes in assignment and be ready to accept any work assigned by laboratory management. - IntermediateMust be well versed with Microsoft office programs, computer literate, and be able to communicate both verbally and in writing. - Intermediate


About Us

Amneal is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of sex, age, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability, veteran status, liability for service in the U.S. Armed Forces or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

title: Lead Inventory Team Member
industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
As an Inventory Control Lead, you will assist in maintaining a high level of inventory by resolving inventory variances and

discrepancies for incoming as well as existing products that arise during the day-to-day operations at the Chick-fil-A Supply Distribution Center in Charlotte (Kannapolis), NC. We are looking for a highly organized team player with exceptional attention to detail and exceptional focus to join our growing team!

About Chick-fil-A Supply

Chick-fil-A Supply, LLC, a wholly owned subsidiary of Chick-fil-A, Inc., is an innovative distribution service provider focused on understanding and meeting the unique needs of Chick-fil-A® restaurants. Chick-fil-A Supply ensures restaurants have the food and products they need through a seamless delivery experience that extends the Chick-fil-A culture of care. For more information, visit cfa-supply.com.

 Timely submission and tracking of damage claims to supplier and/or distribution partners Verify and maintain records on inventory adjustments, movements and transfers, request backup documentation,


and resolve discrepancies

consolidation/organization

audit counts.

and removed from inventory

or location attributes.

Assist in the development of localized policies and procedures as related to the control of inventory Assist with root cause analysis and offer solutions related to inventory inaccuracies Work with team members to reinforce the importance of inventory accuracy


Minimum Qualifications


 Education: High School or equivalent 2 years of warehouse experience


Required Business Qualifications:


 Logical and analytical skills Intermediate proficiency of computer skills; working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, Outlook Familiarity and comfort with navigating and executing in the WMS system Proven record of working independently with little oversight Exceptional attention to detail and highly organized High degree of initiative and urgency Self-Starter and comfortable with ambiguity Proactive problem solver that is solutions oriented Work in extreme temperature conditions for extended periods of time (0 degrees Fahrenheit) Complete physically demanding work, including frequently lifting up to 50 pounds and occasionally moving with mechanical assistance up to 2,000 pounds Reach, bend, and stoop while performing work Work while standing for several hours at a time Prepare for a flexible schedule including weekends and holidays


Preferred Qualifications


 3+ years of warehouse experience Experience in inventory control, claims management, or similar job function is a plus Material handling equipment proficiency

2

title: New Product Development Engineer
description:
About the Role: We are looking for an experienced New Product Development Engineer to join the Internal Ventures, Direct Air Capture team. In this role, you will draw upon engineering knowledge and skills to evaluate material and products for durability and fitness for use. This includes understanding use conditions, development and execution of durability testing, and analyses. In this role you will have the opportunity to develop test methods to qualify and validate processes used to support a first-generation product.

This position will be located at our facility in Elkton, Maryland, with the possibility of a hybrid remote work arrangement, depending upon the responsibilities of the role and business needs.

 Responsibilities:

Develop an understanding of in-field product use by interfacing with team technologists, product specialists and application engineers to acquire relevant testing conditionsDevelop test requirements and test methods to conduct Fitness for Use testing including translating in field conditions to in lab test conditionsDevelop correlations between lab scale testing and in-field use (product lifetime, performance, etc)Qualify and validate raw materials, manufacturing processes, intermediate materials, and final productDevelop and implement sampling plans for intermediate materials and final productEmbrace a high level of uncertainty, in an accelerated project pace


 Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or higher in an engineering or science field and a minimum of 3 years of professional industry experienceDemonstrated ability in developing test methods, executing tests, analyzing data, and documenting resultsDemonstrated ability in creating and implementing sampling plansDemonstrated ability in qualifying raw materials, processes, or productsDemonstrated ability in prioritizing, initiating, and driving projects to completionAbility to travel up to 10%


 Desired Qualifications:

5 years of relevant industry experienceDemonstrated ability in creating correlation factors with testing in the lab to in the fieldPrevious experience in new product developmentPrevious experience working with a start-up


Hybrid Working Arrangements are permitted for Associates in the continental United States (US) and Canada, with appropriate approval and compliance with Gore’s hybrid working policies, from the country in which they are employed.

 

What We Offer: Our success is based on the capability and creativity of our Associates, and we are proud to offer a comprehensive and competitive total rewards program that supports your everyday and helps you build your tomorrow.

We provide benefits that offer choice and flexibility and promote overall well-being. And in keeping with our belief that every Associate should share in the collective success of the enterprise; we provide a distinctive Associate Stock Ownership Plan in each country as well as potential opportunities for “profit-sharing”. Learn more at gore.com/careers/benefits

We believe in the strength of a diverse and inclusive workplace. With diverse perspectives, ideas and experiences, we uncover new possibilities and make a greater impact in the world. We are proud of Associates for building on our rich history of innovation, upholding our values and supporting an inclusive work environment where we treat each other and our external partners with fairness, dignity and respect.

Gore is an equal opportunity employer. title: Coordinator Sample Process
description:
Location: Plymouth, IN 

We are mixing up something new in Plymouth, IN. This is an exciting time to join our team. Pretzels, Inc is now a part of Hershey Salty Snacks. We have over 40 years of experience in making pretzels and delivering high quality snacks to consumers.

Pay:

Starting at $21.81, overnight and weekend shifts have additional shift differential Bi-weekly pay $500 sign-on bonus for eligible candidates 

Total Rewards:

Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, & Vision) starting day 1 401(k) Retirement Plan Paid Time off 

Shifts: The shift for this position is Monday – Friday, normal office hours. 8:00 am – 5:00 with an hour lunch, or 8-4:30 with ½ hr lunch.

Candidate Process:

Please note- communication will be through phone, email, and text. Ensure you have access to a valid email address

Qualified applicants will receive a phone call to schedule an onsite interview Post Offer background check and drug screen required 

Job Summary

Supports Customers, Sales, Quality, Warehouse and Production by solving problems and filling in gaps as they appear to increase efficiency as needed. 

Essential Functions

Coordinates all actions needed for Sales Samples and owns the process, is overall responsible for their completion, from receipt to shipping; works with Sales, Planning, Quality, and Shipping. Assist R&D with Trial Samples and Materials with Packaging Samples as needed, specifically in gathering, packing, and shipping; works with Planning and R&D. Perform Quality Technician job as needed for assistance. Acts as an agent for Change Management by ensuring upcoming changes are communicated when/before they occur. Point of contact to escalate questions to, and conduct audit during the change to ensure the process was done correctly. Will work with the Materials, Production, and Planning teams. Ensure samples are within all quality parameters. Communicate delays to the affected departments. Maintain and update customer portals with requested information. Will be responsible for performing various administrative task for the quality department; including but not limited to COA generation, audit preparation, validation activities, product old and release activities and other duties assigned. 

Duties And Responsibilities

Adhere to Hershey Salty Snacks GMP’s (Good Manufacturing Practices). Communicate accordingly with Managers, Supervisors, PMO’s, Packers, Material Planners, Buyers, and other team members as needed; attend and participate in meetings as required. Review and understand the Production Schedule, maintain overall awareness of production plan, know the production priorities. Understand SAP S/4 and other MRP Systems and Applications used in production and inventory control. Understand how to pull Lead Labels (or other work instructions), know where and how to pull supplies and material needed to execution a Production Job, able to work with Warehouse team members as needed. Set up the Jobs according with work instructions; including cartons, trays, labels scales, tape, skids, wrap skids, and necessary packing materials (Pouches, Film, Tubs, Liners). Use the Zebra printers, able to refill with labels and ribbon as needed, and Load job into computer. Assist Quality teams with items that are on Quality Hold, provide information and assistance. Develop and maintain trackers and paperwork files in assisting with assigned duties, as needed convert system data into reports for team members. Follow all safety rules and policies, follow all general work rules and policies, regular attendance, complete all required trainings, ensure work areas are maintained and kept clean, able to follow directions as required by management, and able to be flexibly and perform other duties assigned. 

Qualifications

High School diploma or GED. Possess basic computer skills, Microsoft Office and MRP systems is preferred. 

Required Skills / Abilities

Proficiency of the English language, ability to read and comprehend simple to complex instructions, interpret documents such as operating and procedure manuals, and able to write correspondence. Ability to effectively present information to other employees of the organization in both written and verbal form. Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed instructions. Ability to deal with and solve problems with minimal information in standard and non-standard situations. Self-motivated, able to work unsupervised and with limited to no guidance. Organized and able to manage multiple priorities effectively, possesses a high attention to detail and the ability to complete forms and enter data with a high level of accuracy. Possesses interpersonal skills, ability to effectively collaborate cross-functionally and accomplish tasks through only influence. 

Physical Demands and Work Environment 

The physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. The working conditions are normal for a manufacturing environment. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

title: Civil Engineering Intern
description:
Schnabel is a 100% employee-owned, professional engineering and consulting firm that focuses on solving problems related to the earth and environment through specialization in geotechnical, geostructural, tunnel, and dam engineering. Schnabel’s high standards for quality, business ethics, and concern for the communities in which we live are a vital part of who we are. Job Description

Are you looking for interesting and meaningful work, a fun and flexible atmosphere, and opportunities to learn, grow and excel? If so, then welcome to Schnabel! Valid driver’s license and a personal vehicle (excluding mileage for commute) will be reimbursed based on the allowable IRS rate for travel assignmentsAbility to pass a background check which may include criminal history, motor vehicle record and credit checkAbility to pass a pre-employment screening

Amergis Healthcare Staffing is hiring MRI Techs. An MRI Techuses magnetic resonance imaging scanners and related equipment to capturespecific images ordered by a physician to aid in patient diagnosis.

For more information,please contact Carl Colvin at cacolvin@amergis.com or (813) 330-9045.

If this is not your ideallocation, we do have other positions throughout the US.

Maintains daily patient MRI log documenting patient information to ensure the quality of patient care, i.e., type and amount of contrast used.Performs computer skills and shows working knowledge of patient orders, status changes, patient changes and profiles. .Adheres to all Amergis and worksite rules, policies and proceduresOther duties as assigned

title: Field Engineer
description:
Continental Tide Defense Systems, Inc. (Continental Tide) is an industry leader, providing engineering and industrial services to the U.S. Navy, U.S. Coast Guard, Military Sealift Command, and other DoD organizations. At Continental Tide, we understand that a great company culture is one where employees know their voice is heard, no matter what their title is, and letting them grow in their role as the company does. We want to provide our employees with the opportunity to learn, be challenged and be in a position where they can succeed, develop new skills, and do things they wouldn't have the opportunity to do elsewhere. In our fast-paced and challenging environment, employees here at Continental Tide can catapult themselves to the top and we’re looking for 'the best at what they do' to join our team and help us grow.
Project Lead Level I and Level II- Field Engineer- AIT
Purpose:Continental Tide has an immediate need for a Project Lead Level I and Level II who will be a key support to Senior Leadership and the Fleet Operations. Quality Assurance. The location of this position is in Virginia Beach, VA.
Note: This is a hands-on, Field position requiring experience from the Deck and Waterfront.
Job Description:Continental Tide is seeking a motivated, energetic AIT experienced Project Lead able to make an immediate positive impact for our Norfolk VA and San Diego CA offices. The candidate’s primary function will be to interface with Continental Tide Program Managers, Project Managers and Project Team Staff. Must have a strong background in the operation, installation, repair, modification, and maintenance of Naval HM&E or Electronic systems and equipment; including but not limited to the supervision of technical support for Alteration/SC installation, maintenance and repair of HM&E ship systems. The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated proficiency in executing programs related to ship Hull, Mechanical & Electrical (HM&E) or electronic system projects and initiatives. Previous direct experience working with the Navy is essential. The Project Lead must clearly demonstrate expertise as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in a specific industrial discipline, e.g. Structural | Electrical | Mechanical, as well as have a good understanding of each of the other disciplines IOT effectively plan and execute the project plan.
As a Project Lead Level II and Level II your responsibilities shall include but not be limited to the following:Responsibilities:Project Planning and Execution: Lead and oversee the planning, execution, and delivery of shipboard HM&E or electronic system projects, ensuring adherence to quality, budget, and timeline requirements.Technical Expertise: Apply in-depth working knowledge of power generation, power transmission, and auxiliary machinery systems to provide technical guidance and ensure project specifications are met.Team Leadership: Lead cross-functional project teams, fostering a collaborative and results-driven work environment. Provide mentorship and support to team members as needed.Quality Assurance: Implement and oversee quality assurance processes to guarantee the delivery of high-quality ship systems.Reporting: Prepare and present regular project status reports to senior management, highlighting key achievements, challenges, and upcoming milestones.
Required Experience:
Qualifications:5 to 7 years previous experience overseeing and directing 'Project-Level' initiatives within corporate or Program-level initiatives and directives.Proven ability to lead a fifteen (5) to (10) tradesperson Alteration Installation Team (AIT).Experience in directing daily production to attain schedule milestones.Knowledge of maintaining QAWB and OQE requirements.Experience communicating directly with management, subcontractors, and customers regarding project cost, staffing, and scheduling.Background in preparing status reports and ensuring plans adhere to contract specifications.Expertise in a variety of field concepts, practices, and procedures.Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.Leads and directs the work of other Continental Tide and subcontractor employees.Requires a wide degree of creativity and latitude.Typically reports to Team Leads.
Desired Qualifications:Knowledge of ship alteration/installation processes and proceduresStrong project management skills, including the ability to plan, execute, and deliver projects on time and within.
Security Requirements:Must be eligible to obtain and maintain a DoD security clearance to access military facilities, naval shipyards, private shipyards, and Naval installations.Due to export control regulations, this role is open to U.S. citizens only.
Travel Requirements:Occasional Travel- up t0 10% within and outside of the continental United States.If a position requires travel by domestic flight or access to secure federal facilities/military bases, candidate must be able to obtain (by start of position) and maintain appropriate identification credentials, such as REAL ID. (More information regarding REAL ID can be found: ( https://www.dhs.gov/real-id )
Physical Requirements:Ability to lift, carry and transport heavy equipment and boxes. The exact weight requirements will be determined by the specific job, but no less than 30 lbs.Ability to work on and climb ladders, work in extreme temperature environments, aboard ships, in shipyards, under industrial conditions and in confined spaces.
Please note: The salary range referenced is a general guideline. Continental Tide considers factors such as (but not limited to) the following when determining base pay: scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate’s related work experience, education/training/certifications, key skills, internal peer equity/external market competitiveness, as well as other business considerations.Benefits:Benefits:Continental Tide offers an empowering professional environment in a culture that stresses teamwork, shared responsibility for company and client success, and personal growth. We offer competitive wages in salaried and hourly positions, educational opportunities, competitive employee benefit options, and a 401K plan with company match. We are always looking for top talent and we look forward to new thinkers and team-players joining our company!Continental Tides Defense Systems, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran”. See all of our latest opportunities at www.continentaltide.com or follow us on our LinkedIn page at www.linkedin.com/company/continental-tide-defense-systems.

title: Senior Project Manager
description:
Credit Acceptance is proud to be an award-winning company with local and national workplace recognition in multiple categories! Our world-class culture is shaped by dedicated Team Members who share a drive to succeed as professionals and together as a company. A great product, amazing people and our stable financial history have made us one of the largest used car finance companies nationally.

Our Support teams work with multiple departments in a dynamic environment that promotes flexibility and autonomy, while offering the opportunity to collaborate with a diverse group of professionals. We work to comply with our company standards, exceed customer expectations and drive our Great Place to Work culture. Through the consistent delivery of quality services and understanding the needs of our business, we develop innovative improvements as we strive towards our company’s Big, Hairy, Audacious Goals!

As a Senior Manager you will be responsible for overseeing a team of Project Manager Associates and Project Managers responsible for executing strategic projects. You will provide support and coaching to team members as they evaluate, execute, and finalize each project. You will also be responsible for applying the concepts of organizational health to develop and maintain a healthy, effective team. Overseeing the work necessary to purchase products and/or services needed from outside the project team.Impact Analysis: Understand the rationale behind and how changes impact the enterprise and/or applications and across the technical ecosystem.Risk Management: Conducting risk management planning, identification, analysis, response planning, and controlling risk on a project.Schedule Management: Performing the work required to manage the completion of the project on time.
